title: Château Turcaud 2016 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This wine is soft and misses out on crisp fruitiness. Hints of the wood aging give some spice to the rounded wine.

title: Cheval Quancard 2016 Chai de Bordes Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This crisp and fruity blend is dominated by 80% Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine is bright with intense, refreshing acidity and a lively aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Concannon 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Flinty and austere in tone, this reserve-tier wine is lemony and tart, with grapefruit flavors heartily enveloped in oak.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Clos Dalian Crianza Grenache (Terra Alta)
description: This is tight and rubbery in feel, without much depth or give to the palate. Herbal tea aromas accent generic red fruit scents. Raspberry, red plum and salty flavors finish choppy but clean.

title: Chapter Capítulo 8 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Castilla La Mancha)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo blend has mild, prickly cactus and citrus aromas and a mix of tropical and green flavors with a slightly bitter finish. It's an everyday white with low acidity.

title: Château la Verrière 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine is crisp, taut and with a strong mineral texture. Spice and green-fruit flavors are shot through with acidity and have a steely edge. Hold the wine until late 2017 for it to soften.

title: Stemmari 2016 Rosato (Terre Siciliane)
description: Here's a fun everyday rosé that offers delicate raspberry and citrus flavors alongside fresh acidity. It's simple but well made, with a clean finish.

title: Sweet Cheeks 2015 Barrel Reserve Merlot (Oregon)
description: Merlot remains a challenge for most Oregon producers who attempt it. This does not rise past the impression of light and grapey soda flavors, with some stiff earthy tannins.

title: South Stage 2012 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)
description: Cab Franc is often a high point in lineups of red wines from the Rogue Valley, but this one misses the mark. A sweaty nose gets it off to a rough start, and the flavors of stems and green tannins do nothing to help the tart generic fruit. It might slip comfortably into a flight of budget Bordeaux from a cool year.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)
description: Named after a local order of monks in the Middle Ages, the wine is rounded and easy. The gentle fruitiness gives the wine a zing of acidity. That's balanced by the open and smooth texture and flavors of creamed apple. Drink now.

title: Domaine Guindon 2015 Sur Lie  (Muscadet Coteaux de la Loire)
description: This is a lightly perfumed wine with crisp acidity and bright lemon flavors. There is a fine zesty tang to this attractive ready-to-drink wine.

title: Domaine Sauvat 2016 Origine Gamay (Côtes d'Auvergne)
description: Produced in Boudes, one of the cru villages of the Côtes d'Auvergne, this is a young fruity wine. It has light tannins that are there to enhance the stalky red fruits. Acidity and a crisp aftertaste complete this attractive wine. Drink now.

title: Eliana 2016 Maiden Rosé (Rogue Valley)
description: This dry rosé is 100% Merlot, fermented in stainless steel. It's rather flat in both mouthfeel and flavor, with nondescript one-dimensional red fruit.

title: Pluvium 2016 Merseguera-Sauvignon Blanc (Valencia)
description: This sound, basic white blend is made from Merseguera and Sauvignon Blanc grapes. Its apple and melon flavors are tasty but simple, the fruit falling off quickly on the finish. Drink now.

title: Pradorey 2014 Adaro  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This Ribera del Duero smells more forced than natural, dominated by oak and clove scents. Its tough, woody palate matches the nose, with resiny berry and plum flavors. On the finish, a strong clove flavor is backed by modest berry fruit.

title: Haras de Pirque 2016 Reserva Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)
description: Peachy aromas come with an oily essence. This basic Chardonnay feels plump and generic, with a shot of zesty acidity. Slightly salty melon and peach flavors don't change much on the finish.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Alandra Branco White (Portuguese Table Wine)
description: This simple fruity wine is perfumed and attractively fragrant. With a blend that includes the unusual Perrum grape (also known as Pedro Ximenez in the Sherry region of Spain), it is smooth, refreshingly creamy and ready to drink.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Aragonez-Syrah Rosé (Alentejano)
description: With no concession to fashionably pale rosés, this is a boldly colored wine. It has red-berry fruits, a soft caramel texture and crisp acidity to balance. Of course, it is ready to drink.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Marquês de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)
description: This popular brand's white version is soft and smooth. There are some citrus flavors to give the wine a crisp edge, although the main thrust of the wine is more towards apricot and perfumed green plums. Drink now.

title: Jidvei 2015 Demi-Sec Pinot Grigio (Jidvei)
description: This wine has light citrus aromas and flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and yellow peach. Pleasant fruit sweetness marks the finish.

title: Lamin 2010 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Heavy oak is a front-row theme throughout this tannic, extracted, black-tinted Garnacha. Hot fudge sundae and sawmill aromas lead to a palate that's as tannic as sandpaper. Its charred, heavily oaked flavors finish chocolaty, with a lasting and overbearing taste of clove, lacking balance and clarity of fruit.

title: Sharecropper's 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Lees notes lead off the aromas and lend a creamy, rich texture to the palate as well. It's a distinctive approach to the variety, not for all tastes.

title: Tierra y Mar 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Pungent earth dominates the nose of this wine while cherry and cassis notes play on the painfully light-bodied yet smoothly textured palate. Smoky oak lingers on the finish.

title: Tres Palacios 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)
description: A gritty element shares space on the nose with peach and melon aromas. This feels round and basic. Flavors of lightly buttered white fruits don't amount to much, while this tastes a bit like salted butter on the finish.

title: Vinihold 2015 Altimo Red (Douro)
description: The wine is full of acidity and with stalky fruit. There is a sharp edge that detracts from the otherwise fruity character of this light crisp wine. This is ready to drink now.

title: Foucher-Lebrun 2015 La Vigne des Sablons Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)
description: A medium-sweet wine, this offers crisp apples as well as touch of honey. It has attractive acidity bringing the texture of the Chenin Blanc into great focus. Drink the wine now.

title: Elkhorn Peak 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Rich cola and cinnamon spiciness round out this light-bodied, somewhat disjointed effort, which presents as syrupy and dense in texture.

title: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2016 Chardonnay (Pays de Loire)
description: Chardonnay from the producer's vineyards in Anjou is the base for this wine. It has a soft creamy texture that is light and fruity without any sign of wood aging. It is round, smooth and ready to drink now.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)
description: Fernão Pires with Sauvignon Blanc allows the second grape's herbal nature to shine. So it is crisp, citrusy and with intense acidity. The wine has a ripe feel with hints of tropical fruit at the end. Drink now.
designation: Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha

title: Château du Claouset 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: With a yeasty aroma, this Vignobles Siozard wine is ripe with hints of yellow fruits as well as a smooth texture. It is soft, with just a final tang of acidity.
